intro: Thalictrum minus subsp. expansum, commonly known as the broadleaf meadow rue, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It has fibrous roots and produces seeds in small, dry fruits. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
